2.name: Abjuration Savant
2.description: The gold and time you must spend to copy an Abjuration spell into your spellbook is halved.

2.name: Arcane Ward
2.description: When you cast an Abjuration spell of 1st level or higher, you can create a magical ward that protects you. The ward has hit points equal to twice your wizard level + your Intelligence modifier. Whenever you take damage, the ward takes the damage instead. If the damage reduces the ward to 0 hit points, you take any remaining damage. While the ward has 0 hit points, it can't absorb damage, but its magic remains. When you cast an Abjuration spell of 1st level or higher, the ward regains a number of hit points equal to twice the level of the spell slot used to cast that spell.

6.name: Projected Ward
6.description: When a creature you can see within 9m / 30ft takes damage, you can use your reaction to have your Arcane Ward absorb that damage. If you do, the ward takes the damage instead, and if you have damage resistance from other sources, that resistance applies to the damage absorbed by the ward.

10.name: Improved Abjuration
10.description: When you cast an Abjuration spell that requires you to make an ability check as a part of casting that spell (such as Counterspell or Dispel Magic), you add your proficiency bonus to that ability check.
